OODCwk
Interface Game

public interface Game

This interface specifies the behaviour expected from the CODE system as required for 6COM1037 - Nov 2016

Version:
02/10/2016
Author:
A.A.Marczyk

Method Summary
 boolean dischargeChampion(java.lang.String name)
          Discharges a champion from the army and add half of their hire fee to the treasury.Champion must be active or resting.Champion should now be for hire.
 java.lang.String getAllChallenges()
          Provides a String representation of all challenges
 java.lang.String getAllChampionsForHire()
          Returns a String representation of all champions available for hire
 java.lang.String getArmy()
          Returns a String representation of the champions in the player's army with an appropriate header, or the message "No champions hired"
 java.lang.String getChallenge(int num)
          Provides a String representation of a challenge given by challenge number pre-condition isChallenge(num)
 java.lang.String getChampion(java.lang.String name)
          Returns details of a champion with the given name
 int getMoney()
          returns the amount of money in the treasury
 java.lang.String getName()
          Returns the name of the player
 boolean hasLost()
          returns true if treasury <=0 and the army has no champions who can be discharged.
 java.lang.String hireChampion(java.lang.String name)
          Allows a champion to be hired for the army, if there is enough money in the treasury for their hire fee.The champion's state is set to "active"
 boolean isChallenge(int num)
          returns true if the number represents a challenge
 boolean isInArmy(java.lang.String name)
          Returns true if the champion with the specified name is in the player's army, false otherwise.
 java.lang.String meetChallenge(int challNo)
          Meets the challenge represented by the challenge number (or returns " - no such challenge").Find a champion from the army who can meet the challenge and return a result which is one of the following: Challenge won by...
 java.lang.String toString()
          Returns a String representation of the state of the game, including the name of the player, state of the treasury,whether player has lost or is still OK, and the champions in the army (or, "No champions" if army is empty)
 

Method Detail

dischargeChampion

boolean dischargeChampion(java.lang.String name)
Discharges a champion from the army and add half of their hire fee to the treasury.Champion must be active or resting.Champion should now be for hire. pre-condition: isInArmy(name)and is not dead

Parameters:
name - is the name of the champion
Returns:
true if discharged, else false

getAllChallenges

java.lang.String getAllChallenges()
Provides a String representation of all challenges

Returns:
returns a String representation of of all challenges

getAllChampionsForHire

java.lang.String getAllChampionsForHire()
Returns a String representation of all champions available for hire

Returns:
a String representation of all champions available for hire

getArmy

java.lang.String getArmy()
Returns a String representation of the champions in the player's army with an appropriate header, or the message "No champions hired"

Returns:
a String representation of the champions in the player's army

getChallenge

java.lang.String getChallenge(int num)
Provides a String representation of a challenge given by challenge number pre-condition isChallenge(num)

Parameters:
num - the number of the challenge
Returns:
returns a String representation of a challenge given by the challenge number

getChampion

java.lang.String getChampion(java.lang.String name)
Returns details of a champion with the given name

Returns:
details of a champion with the given name

getMoney

int getMoney()
returns the amount of money in the treasury

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the player

Returns:
the name of the player

hasLost

boolean hasLost()
returns true if treasury <=0 and the army has no champions who can be discharged.

hireChampion

java.lang.String hireChampion(java.lang.String name)
Allows a champion to be hired for the army, if there is enough money in the treasury for their hire fee.The champion's state is set to "active"

Parameters:
name - is the name of the champion
Returns:
name and either "- not found" if champion not found,or "- cannot be hired" if champion is not for hire,already hired/dead, "- hired and avialable" if champion hired, "- not enough money" if not enough money in the treasury

isChallenge

boolean isChallenge(int num)
returns true if the number represents a challenge

Parameters:
num - is the reference number of the challenge

isInArmy

boolean isInArmy(java.lang.String name)
Returns true if the champion with the specified name is in the player's army, false otherwise.

Parameters:
name - is the name of the champion
Returns:
true if the champion with the name is in the player's army, false otherwise.

meetChallenge

java.lang.String meetChallenge(int challNo)
Meets the challenge represented by the challenge number (or returns " - no such challenge").Find a champion from the army who can meet the challenge and return a result which is one of the following: Challenge won by... add reward to treasury, set the champion to resting and add the name of champion, Challenge lost as no champion active� � deduct reward from treasury,Challenge lost on skill level - deduct reward from treasury, the champion is killed, so add " is dead" to the return String. If the challenge is lost and there is no money left, add "You have NO money in the treasury".

Parameters:
challNo - is the reference number of the challenge
Returns:
a String showing the result of meeting the challenge

toString

java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation of the state of the game, including the name of the player, state of the treasury,whether player has lost or is still OK, and the champions in the army (or, "No champions" if army is empty)

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a String representation of the state of the game, including the name of the player, state of the treasury, whether player has lost or is still OK, and the champions in the army (or, "No champions" if army is empty)
